intro: Cyclosorus taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan cyclosorus, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is native to the freshwater habitats of Taiwan and is characterized by its small, floating leaves that form a rosette shape. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving waters and has a delicate, branched rhizome system. Its reproductive structures include small, yellowish sori that are clustered on the undersides of the leaves. Cyclosorus taiwanensis is valued for its ecological role in maintaining water quality and its ornamental appeal in aquatic gardens.
